pf2e-threat-tracker.config.title: Traits Configuration
pf2e-threat-tracker.config.traits.label: Trait Threats
pf2e-threat-tracker.notifications.enable: Scene reload required to apply changes
pf2e-threat-tracker.settings.attackThrea: Custom mode, attacks reduce threat instead of applying it
pf2e-threat-tracker.settings.baseAttackT: Amount of threat generated when an attack hits
pf2e-threat-tracker.settings.baseHealThr: Base threat generated when healing an ally, to which the amount healed is added
pf2e-threat-tracker.settings.baseSpellTh: Base threat generated when casting a spell, to which the amount of damage dealt is added
pf2e-threat-tracker.settings.enableThrea: Disable this if you don't want to see the floating threat table on the canvas
pf2e-threat-tracker.settings.enableTopTh: Displays a visual effect on the token with the most threat
pf2e-threat-tracker.settings.skillBase.h: Base threat generated by a Skills and Feats maneuver
pf2e-threat-tracker.settings.skillBase.n: Base Threat from Skills and Feats
pf2e-threat-tracker.settings.skillCritBo: Additional threat generated on a critical success in a skill/feat maneuver
Bonus Threat from Critical Skills and Feats
pf2e-threat-tracker.settings.threatPerSp: Additional threat generated when casting a spell for each rank of the spell.
pf2e-threat-tracker.settings.topThreatEf: Path of the visual asset that will be displayed on the target with the most threat (recommended JB2A)
Visual Effect for Top Threat (Requires Sequencer)
pf2e-threat-tracker.settings.traitVulner: Adds a multiplier to vulnerabilities by traits based on lore about Golarion
Lore Wise Vulnerabilities (Needs to be revamped, it does not work for now)
pf2e-threat-tracker.settings.xFactor.hin: Horizontal offset of the threat panel (in pixels)
pf2e-threat-tracker.settings.yFactor.hin: Vertical offset of the threat panel (in pixels)
pf2e-threat-tracker.Settings.decayFactor: Determines how quickly threat values converge to the average each round. 0 equalizes all threats to the average, 1 applies only decay without additional convergence.
